preqs: Students must have passed one of the following units: AFF1300, BFF1300, BFB1001, BFC1001, BFF1001, BFP1001, BFW1001 PLUS one of the following units: ETB1100, ETF1100, ETP1100 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFF1300, BFB1001, BFF1001, BFF1300} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETB1100, ETF1100, ETP1100, ETX1100} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})

(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFF1300, BFF1300} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETX1100} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})

description: An overview of the role of equity markets. Topics cover types of equity instruments; the role of broker and market maker; trading conventions and listing requirements of the ASX; the structure and operation of major overseas stock exchanges; an introduction to market micro structure theory; the enterprise market; other markets of the ASX; current issues related to Australia's equity markets.
